title: Impressive "New" Book.
content:
“Type-one : discipline and progress in typography”, R Klanten et al., ed.

Well, it’s not really that new (it’s from 2004) which makes me wonder why I hadn’t heard anybody mention it before. One of my students brought it to class the other day, and it’s really a great collection of type design efforts - plus it’s very well-produced. A definite Buy Recommendation.

Just for reference - not a plug for Amazon:  
 [http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/3899550560/ref=sr\_11\_1/104-2497787-2534...](http://web.archive.org/web/20070813140127/http:/www.amazon.com/gp/product/3899550560/ref=sr_11_1/104-2497787-2534339?%5Fencoding=UTF8 "http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/3899550560/ref=sr\_11\_1/104-2497787-2534339?%5Fencoding=UTF8")

comments.content: It is, indeed, an excellent documentation of many experimental type projects. I recommend it to all the young designers in my department.

Most of the books I’ve seen from this publisher, [Die Gestalten Verlag](http://web.archive.org/web/20070813140127/http:/www.die-gestalten.de/), are very high quality. I believe they published the [Büro Destruct](http://web.archive.org/web/20070813140127/http:/www.burodestruct.net/bureaudestruct/index.html) monographs as well.

Amazone advised me Type One by the “Customers who bought this item also bought…” function. I thought about buying it, so thanx that you advised it too! No I could be sure that its not a misinvestment :)

Off topic: Where are you teaching, Hrant!?

Bye: Steven
